reviewText: So far as I know this is one of only three available films made about the Erie Canal .The best one was made by Canadians in September of 2001.

Along The Erie Canal At Lockport, Tom Grasso shows the five combined (double) locks of the original Erie, and the two Barge Canal locks which replaced them - and meet some old friends. More clips available on Google video (search term "docfilm")

This is the intro to "Along the Erie Canal". The film is divided into 4 sections: Introduction - The Importance of Waterways, showing why the canal was needed; Clinton's Ditch, on the original canal; The Enlarged Erie, on the later canal; and The Barge Canal, on the canal as it is today.
